comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: A Miss Dolly Kimbrough (note spelling) is mentioned a few times in the 1915 New York Times, heading a women's fundraising team for a building for the Newsboys Home Club. Miss Mildred Taylor gets a nice long mention, description, and quote in this October 1915 article about the vote for suffrage in New Jersey. She's called "the little New York suffragette," and mentioned in connection with a Victory Van campaign. She's also mentioned in reports of the October 1915 suffrage parade in New York City: "One of its features was the suffrage van driven by Miss Mildred Taylor, drawn by two white horses decorated with the colors of the [Women's Political] Union and preceded by the 'Van Guard'--a party of women who have campaigned with Miss Taylor all summer."

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: pennylrichardsca: Thank you for the NYT articles which mention these suffragists. We will include some of the information in our updated description for this image.
